title: Improve code readability by using the bean-like naming convention.
Failed ExpectedExpection does not show the stacktrace of the actual exception
body:
When an ExpectedException is not satisfied, the stacktrace of the actual thrown Throwable disappears. It's important that the stacktrace is shown so you may zero in where it is raised.

In the following gist, the first example shows the AssertionError originating from the assertNull line, but the second doesn't.

https://gist.github.com/brunokim/9675101

title: Improve project code readability by refactoring class field names.
body: This pull request deals with refactoring class field names across the whole project (including tests) with accordance to the more modern bean-style naming convention (instead of "f"-prefixed obfuscating style). No any program logic was changed. All tests passed successfully.

title: @ displayed incorrectly in javadocs
body:
This is how it's displayed when rendered: http://junit.org/javadoc/latest/org/junit/Assume.html

Used the same escaping strategy as in RunWith's javadocs source (https://github.com/junit-team/junit/blob/master/src/main/java/org/junit/runner/RunWith.java)

title: Optimize junit.framework.ComparisonCompactor
body: Rewrite code for better readability, introduce thread-safety, eliminate duplicate computation of prefix/suffix strings.

title: Rewrite ComparisonCompactor in org.junit.ComparisonFailure to be easier to read
body: Remove duplicate prefix/suffix compaction, modularize methods for computing shared prefixes/suffixes, introduce thread-safety. Improve general code readability.

title: Improve project code readability by refactoring class field names in org.junit tree.
body: Field names (except for public or protected in non-final classes) in classes under org.junit tree should be refactored in accordance with Google Java Coding Guidelines. Namely, prefixes should be removed for better readability. See #848 and #846 where the topic originated.

title: Assumption message is not printed to the console on assumption violation.
Method org.junit.Assume.assumeNotNull() doesn't allow to specify an assumption violation message.
body: Class org.junit.Assume has method void assumeNotNull(Object... objects). It would easier to use the API if there was a method which allows to specify assumption violation message. E.g. void assumeNotNull(String message, Object... objects)

title: FrameworkMethod has awkward dependency on ParameterSignature
body:
This dependency strikes me as going in the wrong direction.

Maybe deprecate FrameworkMethod.getParameterSignatures(), and have callers call ParameterSignature.signatures(fMethod.getMethod())?

title: Add note about following the Google Java Style
Improve the documentation of the assumptions usage scenarios.
Fix a typo in BeforeClass
For #855, remove FrameworkMethod.getParameterSignatures()
body:
Having this method in place made a class from the "core" of JUnit
(org.junit.runners.model) depend on something from "experimental" --
a dependency going in the wrong direction.

title: Mistake in 'Assertions' Wiki page
Is it possible to reincarnate assertEquals(double,double)/assertEquals(float,float)?
body:
Why not using Double.compare (or Double.doubleToLongBits and Float.floatToIntBits explicitly) to compare doubles and floats accordingly within now deprecated assertEquals(double,double)?
I personally prefer this comparison rather than using delta.

title: Delete classes that are deprecated for six years.
fixes #861
body:
resurrecting assertEquals(double,double) and 
assertEquals(float,float) methods

Signed-off-by: Alexander Jipa <alexander.jipa@gmail.com>

title: Could we remove deprecation from array's assertEquals?
body: The methods call desired assertArrayEquals and there's little point in removing the methods so maybe it's OK to remove deprecation?

title: remove deprecation from array assertEquals
body:
deprecation is removed for array's assertEquals

Signed-off-by: Alexander Jipa <alexander.jipa@gmail.com>

title: Verify public test class
Small fixes, mainly in throws signatures
body: Small refactoring changes: removed redundant throws clauses, small preformance improvements: string concatenation replaced by chained StringBuffer:append methods; passing proper array size in Collection:toArray methods.

title: When will Junit 4.12 be released?
body: I've been searching for a roadmap for the project but failed to find anything useful. Is there some designated date when will 4.12 be released?

title: JUnit4TestAdapter with a class with no test methods should result in a Test with no children
body:
wrapping several initialisation errors into one
not triggering notifier in case test is not run

Signed-off-by: Alexander Jipa <alexander.jipa@gmail.com>

title: fixes #117
body:
null check for test class in ErrorReportingRunner

Signed-off-by: Alexander Jipa <alexander.jipa@gmail.com>

title: Fix ErrorReportingRunner to not accept a null class (fixes #177)
body: null check for test class in ErrorReportingRunner

title: Hamcrest-all 1.3 with JUnit 4.11 throws exception
body:
Hi,

In the ExpectedException class there is this import:
```import static org.hamcrest.CoreMatchers.containsString; ```
which cannot be resolved if you use hamcrest-all simply because the containsString method is in ```org.hamcrest.Matchers. ```

title: A link describing the usage of Test runner for console in the wiki is no longer available
body:
Hi,

Was reading wiki and found that the link  http://junit.org/apidocs/junit/textui/TestRunner.html describing the usage of Test runner under https://github.com/junit-team/junit/wiki/Test-runners is no longer available.

Cheers,
Sien

title: Listener based Runner
body:
Hi Junit team,

I like your framework it is very useful for me. The only thing what is a bit pain for me is that how to extend your framework with multiple requirement.
Please see my extension https://bitbucket.org/gege83/junit-extension/wiki/Home
If you can use please notify me.

Thankyou

title: Change in behavior for Timeout Rule in 4.12
